columns.text: In this problem, we need to state which company will probably have a longer credit period and explain why.
The credit period is the period of time during which a loan is granted to a client of the company. The buyer must pay for all goods and services purchased at the end of that credit period.

**a)**  Answer: Firm B

Firm B will probably have a longer credit period because it sells toupees - a proven product. A miracle cure for baldness, sold by firm A,  may be really good, but most customers will still be skeptical about whether the drug really works.

**b)**  Answer: Firm A 

It is likely that firm A will have a longer credit period because landlords have significantly greater collateral, and that collateral is not mobile.

**c)**  Answer: Firm A 

It is likely that firm A will have a longer credit period because they are turn over inventory less frequently so they probably have a longer inventory period.

**d)**  Answer: Firm B

It is likely that firm B will have a longer credit period because it sells canned fruit that have a longer shelf life and are less perishable in that form than fresh fruit sold by firm A.

**e)**  Answer: Firm A

It is likely that firm A will have a longer credit period because it sells and transports carpets that are tailored to the needs of the customer and it is not easy to transfer them. On the other hand, firm  B sells rugs that are easily portable and are mostly of standard dimensions.
